text: Longobardi L (2024). peskas.malawi.data.pipeline: Functions Implement Malawi Small Scale Fisheries Data Pipeline. R package version 1.2.0.

what: Add timestamp and sha string to a file name — add_version
title: Add timestamp and sha string to a file name — add_version
text: alternative version data name using sha (unique identifier) code using generate process data time data generated processed. function adds information, version identifier, file name (character string)

title: Add timestamp and sha string to a file name — add_version
Add timestamp and sha string to a file name — add_version
text: filename Path sans extension file version extension Extension file sha_nchar Number characters SHA use version identifier sep Characters separating version identifier file name

title: Add timestamp and sha string to a file name — add_version
text: character string file name version identifier

title: Add timestamp and sha string to a file name — add_version
text: SHA information retrieved using git2r::sha. code running context aware git repository (example code running inside container) function attempts get sha environment variable GITHUB_SHA. methods fail, sha versioning added.

title: Add timestamp and sha string to a file name — add_version

what: Generate an Alert Vector Based on Outlier Detection — alert_outlier
title: Generate an Alert Vector Based on Outlier Detection — alert_outlier
text: function uses univOutl::LocScaleB() function detect outliers numeric vector generates alert vector based results.

title: Generate an Alert Vector Based on Outlier Detection — alert_outlier
code: alert_outlier(   x,   no_alert_value = NA_real_,   alert_if_larger = no_alert_value,   alert_if_smaller = no_alert_value,   ... )

title: Generate an Alert Vector Based on Outlier Detection — alert_outlier
text: x Numeric vector outliers checked no_alert_value Value put output alert (x within bounds) alert_if_larger Alert value x bounds found univOutl::LocScaleB() alert_if_smaller Alert value x bounds found univOutl::LocScaleB() ... Additional arguments passed univOutl::LocScaleB()

title: Generate an Alert Vector Based on Outlier Detection — alert_outlier
text: vector length x, containing alert values no_alert_value

title: Generate an Alert Vector Based on Outlier Detection — alert_outlier
text: function first checks input vector contains NA zero values, median absolute deviation zero. cases, returns NA_real_. Otherwise, uses univOutl::LocScaleB() determine bounds generates alerts accordingly.

title: Export Selected Landings Data — export_landings
text: function retrieves validated landings data MongoDB collection, selects specific columns, uploads selected data another MongoDB collection use summary applications.

title: Export Selected Landings Data — export_landings
text: log_threshold Logging threshold level (default: logger::DEBUG)

title: Export Selected Landings Data — export_landings
text: function return value. processes data uploads selected fields MongoDB collection app database.

title: Export Selected Landings Data — export_landings
text: function performs following main operations: Retrieves validated landings data validated MongoDB collection. Standardizes 'gillnets' list column. Selects specific columns validated data, including: Basic information (form name, submission ID, survey ID, landing date) Location data (sample district, landing site, latitude, longitude) Fishing details (number fishers, trip length, gear) Catch information (usage, taxon, price, weight, price per kg USD) Uploads selected data summary MongoDB collection app database.

title: Export Selected Landings Data — export_landings
text: function requires configuration file present readable 'read_config' function, provide MongoDB connection details collection names pipeline app databases.

what: Recursively Flatten a Nested List with Concatenated Names — flatten_with_names
title: Recursively Flatten a Nested List with Concatenated Names — flatten_with_names
text: flatten_with_names function recursively traverses nested list flattens single-level list. names elements resulting list formed concatenating names level, separated dots. useful transforming deeply nested data structures flat format suitable data frames tibbles.

title: Recursively Flatten a Nested List with Concatenated Names — flatten_with_names
Recursively Flatten a Nested List with Concatenated Names — flatten_with_names
text: x nested list flattened. parent_name character string representing name prefix parent recursion level. Defaults empty string.

title: Recursively Flatten a Nested List with Concatenated Names — flatten_with_names
text: named list element corresponds leaf node original nested list, names reflect path node.

title: Recursively Flatten a Nested List with Concatenated Names — flatten_with_names
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ nested_list <- list(   group = list(     subgroup = list(       item1 = 1,       item2 = 2     ),     item3 = 3   ),   item4 = 4 ) flatten_with_names(nested_list) # Expected output: # $group.subgroup.item1 # [1] 1 # # $group.subgroup.item2 # [1] 2 # # $group.item3 # [1] 3 # # $item4 # [1] 4 } # }

what: Get Bounds for Outlier Detection — get_bounds
title: Get Bounds for Outlier Detection — get_bounds
text: function calculates bounds outlier detection using LocScaleB method.

title: Get Bounds for Outlier Detection — get_bounds
Get Bounds for Outlier Detection — get_bounds
text: x numeric vector. data bounds calculated. k optional numeric value. Controls sensitivity outlier detection method.

title: Get Bounds for Outlier Detection — get_bounds
text: numeric vector bounds input data.

title: Get Bounds for Outlier Detection — get_bounds
code: get_bounds(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), k = 3) #> Warning: Please note that log(x+1) transformation is applied #> No outliers found #> lower.low  upper.up  #>  0.106742  2.665847

title: Get Catch Bounds — get_catch_bounds
text: function calculates upper bounds catch data based gear type, catch name, weight type using LocScaleB function outlier detection.

title: Get Catch Bounds — get_catch_bounds
text: data data frame containing columns: gear, catch_taxon, weight_type, catch_kg. k numeric value used LocScaleB function outlier detection.

title: Get Catch Bounds — get_catch_bounds
text: data frame columns: gear, catch_taxon, weight_type, upper.(upper bound).

title: Get Catch Bounds — get_catch_bounds
text: function filters rows catch_taxon "0" "no_catch". splits data based interaction gear, catch_taxon, weight_type. get_bounds() function applied group's catch_kg values. resulting upper bounds combined transformed back log scale.

title: Get metadata tables — get_metadata
text: Get Metadata tables Google sheets. function downloads tables include information fishery.

title: Get metadata tables — get_metadata
text: log_threshold logging threshold level. Default logger::DEBUG.

title: Get metadata tables — get_metadata
text: parameters needed conf.yml :
code: storage:   storage_name:     key:     options:       project:       bucket:       service_account_key:

title: Get metadata tables — get_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Ensure you have the necessary configuration in conf.yml metadata_tables <- get_metadata() } # }

title: Get Catch Price Bounds — get_pricekg_bounds
text: function calculates upper lower bounds catch price data based catch taxon, using LocScaleB function outlier detection.

title: Get Catch Price Bounds — get_pricekg_bounds
text: data data frame containing columns: catch_taxon, catch_price_type, price_kg_USD. k numeric value used LocScaleB function outlier detection.

title: Get Catch Price Bounds — get_pricekg_bounds
text: data frame columns: catch_taxon, lower.low (lower bound), upper.(upper bound).

title: Get Catch Price Bounds — get_pricekg_bounds
text: function filters rows catch_taxon "0" "no_catch". splits data based catch_taxon applies get_bounds() function group's price_kg_USD values. resulting bounds combined transformed back log scale.

what: Retrieve Trip Points from Pelagic Data API — get_trip_points
title: Retrieve Trip Points from Pelagic Data API — get_trip_points
text: function retrieves trip points Pelagic Data API specified time range, options filter IMEIs include additional information.

title: Retrieve Trip Points from Pelagic Data API — get_trip_points
code: get_trip_points(   token = NULL,   secret = NULL,   dateFrom = NULL,   dateTo = NULL,   imeis = NULL,   deviceInfo = FALSE,   errant = FALSE,   withLastSeen = FALSE,   tags = NULL )

title: Retrieve Trip Points from Pelagic Data API — get_trip_points
text: token Character string. API token authentication. secret Character string. API secret authentication. dateFrom Character string. Start date 'YYYY-MM-dd' format. dateTo Character string. End date 'YYYY-MM-dd' format. imeis Character vector. Optional. Filter IMEI numbers. deviceInfo Logical. TRUE, include device IMEI ID fields response. Default FALSE. errant Logical. TRUE, include errant GPS points response. Default FALSE. withLastSeen Logical. TRUE, include device last seen date response. Default FALSE. tags Character vector. Optional. Filter trip tags.

title: Retrieve Trip Points from Pelagic Data API — get_trip_points
text: data frame containing trip points data.

title: Retrieve Trip Points from Pelagic Data API — get_trip_points
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ trip_points <- get_trip_points(   token = "your_token",   secret = "your_secret",   dateFrom = "2020-05-01",   dateTo = "2020-05-02",   imeis = c("123456789", "987654321"),   deviceInfo = TRUE,   errant = TRUE,   withLastSeen = TRUE,   tags = c("tag1", "tag2") ) } # }

what: Retrieve Trip Details from Pelagic Data API — get_trips
title: Retrieve Trip Details from Pelagic Data API — get_trips
text: function retrieves trip details Pelagic Data API specified time range, options filter IMEIs include additional information.

title: Retrieve Trip Details from Pelagic Data API — get_trips
code: get_trips(   token = NULL,   secret = NULL,   dateFrom = NULL,   dateTo = NULL,   imeis = NULL,   deviceInfo = FALSE,   withLastSeen = FALSE,   tags = NULL )

title: Retrieve Trip Details from Pelagic Data API — get_trips
text: token Character string. API token authentication. secret Character string. API secret authentication. dateFrom Character string. Start date 'YYYY-MM-dd' format. dateTo Character string. End date 'YYYY-MM-dd' format. imeis Character vector. Optional. Filter IMEI numbers. deviceInfo Logical. TRUE, include device IMEI ID fields response. Default FALSE. withLastSeen Logical. TRUE, include device last seen date response. Default FALSE. tags Character vector. Optional. Filter trip tags.

title: Retrieve Trip Details from Pelagic Data API — get_trips
text: data frame containing trip details.

title: Retrieve Trip Details from Pelagic Data API — get_trips
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ trips <- get_trips(   token = "your_token",   secret = "your_secret",   dateFrom = "2020-05-01",   dateTo = "2020-05-03",   imeis = c("123456789", "987654321"),   deviceInfo = TRUE,   withLastSeen = TRUE,   tags = c("tag1", "tag2") ) } # }

what: Ingest Survey landings from Kobotoolbox into MongoDB — ingest_landings
title: Ingest Survey landings from Kobotoolbox into MongoDB — ingest_landings
text: function downloads survey landings data Kobotoolbox multiple assets, processes tidy format, uploads processed data MongoDB database. function logs progress various stages. Configuration parameters URL, asset IDs, usernames, passwords read configuration file using read_config().

title: Ingest Survey landings from Kobotoolbox into MongoDB — ingest_landings
Ingest Survey landings from Kobotoolbox into MongoDB — ingest_landings
text: log_threshold (standard Apache log4j) log level used threshold logging infrastructure. See logger::log_levels details. Default logger::DEBUG.

title: Ingest Survey landings from Kobotoolbox into MongoDB — ingest_landings
text: function performs side effects (downloads data, processes , uploads MongoDB) return value.

title: Ingest Survey landings from Kobotoolbox into MongoDB — ingest_landings
text: function performs following steps: Sets logging threshold specified level. Reads configuration parameters using read_config(). Sets parallel processing plan using future::plan(). Downloads processes data asset ID using process_asset(). Renames specific columns consistency across different forms. Uploads processed data MongoDB collection using mdb_collection_push().

title: Ingest Survey landings from Kobotoolbox into MongoDB — ingest_landings
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Define asset information asset_info <- dplyr::tibble(   asset_id = c("asset1", "asset2"),   form_name = c("Form A", "Form B") )  # Ingest survey lnadings ingest_landings() } # }

title: Retrieve Data from MongoDB — mdb_collection_pull
text: function connects MongoDB database retrieves documents specified collection, maintaining original column order available.

title: Retrieve Data from MongoDB — mdb_collection_pull
code: mdb_collection_pull(   connection_string = NULL,   collection_name = NULL,   db_name = NULL )

title: Retrieve Data from MongoDB — mdb_collection_pull
text: connection_string character string specifying MongoDB connection URL. Default NULL. collection_name character string specifying name collection query. Default NULL. db_name character string specifying name database. Default NULL.

title: Retrieve Data from MongoDB — mdb_collection_pull
text: data frame containing documents specified collection, columns ordered data originally pushed MongoDB.

title: Retrieve Data from MongoDB — mdb_collection_pull
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve data from a MongoDB collection result <- mdb_collection_pull(   connection_string = "mongodb://localhost:27017",   collection_name = "my_collection",   db_name = "my_database" ) } # }

what: Upload Data to MongoDB and Overwrite Existing Content — mdb_collection_push
title: Upload Data to MongoDB and Overwrite Existing Content — mdb_collection_push
text: function connects MongoDB database, removes existing documents specified collection, inserts new data. also stores original column order maintain data structure consistency.

title: Upload Data to MongoDB and Overwrite Existing Content — mdb_collection_push
code: mdb_collection_push(   data = NULL,   connection_string = NULL,   collection_name = NULL,   db_name = NULL )

title: Upload Data to MongoDB and Overwrite Existing Content — mdb_collection_push
text: data data frame containing data uploaded. connection_string character string specifying MongoDB connection URL. collection_name character string specifying name collection. db_name character string specifying name database.

title: Upload Data to MongoDB and Overwrite Existing Content — mdb_collection_push
text: number data documents inserted collection (excluding order document).

title: Upload Data to MongoDB and Overwrite Existing Content — mdb_collection_push
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Upload and overwrite data in a MongoDB collection result <- mdb_collection_push(   data = processed_legacy_landings,   connection_string = "mongodb://localhost:27017",   collection_name = "my_collection",   db_name = "my_database" ) } # }

what: peskas.malawi.data.pipeline: Functions to Implement the Malawi Small Scale Fisheries Data Pipeline — peskas.malawi.data.pipeline-package
title: peskas.malawi.data.pipeline: Functions to Implement the Malawi Small Scale Fisheries Data Pipeline — peskas.malawi.data.pipeline-package
text: package implements data modelling pipelines underpinning Peskas system Malawi's small scale fisheries. provides functions data ingestion, preprocessing, validation, storage, supporting efficient management analysis fisheries data.

title: peskas.malawi.data.pipeline: Functions to Implement the Malawi Small Scale Fisheries Data Pipeline — peskas.malawi.data.pipeline-package

title: Preprocess Landings Data — preprocess_landings
text: function imports, preprocesses, cleans legacy landings data MongoDB collection. performs various data cleaning transformation operations, including column renaming, removal unnecessary columns, generation unique identifiers, data type conversions. processed data uploaded back MongoDB.

title: Preprocess Landings Data — preprocess_landings
text: log_threshold Logging threshold level (default: logger::DEBUG)

title: Preprocess Landings Data — preprocess_landings
text: function return value. Instead, processes data uploads result MongoDB collection pipeline database.

title: Preprocess Landings Data — preprocess_landings
text: function performs following main operations: Pulls raw data raw data MongoDB collection. Removes unnecessary columns standardizes list columns. Renames reorganizes columns clarity consistency. Generates unique 'survey_id' field. Merges consolidates data various form versions. Processes gear-specific effort data. Handles GPS coordinates. Converts data types fixes nested column fields. Recode variables drop trailing spaces ensure consistency clarity. Uploads processed data preprocessed MongoDB collection.

title: Preprocess Landings Data — preprocess_landings
text: function requires configuration file present readable 'read_config' function, provide MongoDB connection details.

what: Process Data for a Single Asset ID — process_asset
title: Process Data for a Single Asset ID — process_asset
text: process_asset function downloads data Kobotoolbox given asset ID, processes submission using process_survey function, compiles results single tibble. handles errors gracefully using safe version processing function.

title: Process Data for a Single Asset ID — process_asset
Process Data for a Single Asset ID — process_asset
text: asset_id character string representing asset ID process. conf list containing configuration parameters URL, username, password Kobotoolbox.

title: Process Data for a Single Asset ID — process_asset
text: tibble containing processed survey data specified asset ID, NULL data available.

title: Process Data for a Single Asset ID — process_asset
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assuming 'conf' is a configuration list obtained from read_config() asset_data <- process_asset("asset123", conf) } # }

what: Process Survey Data into a Tidy Tibble — process_survey
title: Process Survey Data into a Tidy Tibble — process_survey
text: process_survey function processes survey data structure, may contain multiple vessels catches, converts tidy tibble suitable analysis merging surveys. handles hierarchical nature data flattening nested lists properly aligning survey-level, vessel-level, catch-level information.

title: Process Survey Data into a Tidy Tibble — process_survey
Process Survey Data into a Tidy Tibble — process_survey
text: x list representing single survey, containing survey-level data nested vessel data.

title: Process Survey Data into a Tidy Tibble — process_survey
text: tibble row represents catch vessel within survey, including survey-level data, vessel-level data, catch-level data. tibble includes columns vessel_number catch_number identify vessel catch within survey.

title: Process Survey Data into a Tidy Tibble — process_survey
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assume 'single_survey' is a survey data list obtained from the API tidy_survey <- process_survey(single_survey) head(tidy_survey)  # To process multiple surveys stored in a list 'surveys': all_surveys <- purrr::map_dfr(surveys, process_survey) } # }

title: Read configuration file — read_config

what: Standardize a List-Column in a Data Frame — standardize_list_column
title: Standardize a List-Column in a Data Frame — standardize_list_column
text: function standardizes specified list-column data frame, ensuring elements within column consistent structure. particularly useful dealing data frames containing nested lists data frames may inconsistent structures due data serialization deserialization processes.

title: Standardize a List-Column in a Data Frame — standardize_list_column
Standardize a List-Column in a Data Frame — standardize_list_column
text: data data frame containing list-column standardize. column_name string specifying name list-column standardize.

title: Standardize a List-Column in a Data Frame — standardize_list_column
text: data frame specified list-column standardized, ready unnesting.

title: Standardize a List-Column in a Data Frame — standardize_list_column
text: function iterates element specified list-column standardizes structure follows: element data frame, remains unchanged. element empty list (.e., list()), converted NULL. element list containing single data frame, extracts returns data frame. element list multiple data frames, combines single data frame using dplyr::bind_rows(). element NULL, remains NULL. types elements set NULL. standardization ensures list-column can unnested without errors, facilitating consistent data processing analysis.

title: Standardize a List-Column in a Data Frame — standardize_list_column
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load necessary libraries library(dplyr) library(tidyr)  # Sample data frame with inconsistent 'gillnets' column core_data <- data.frame(   submission_id = c(1, 2, 3),   gillnets = list(     data.frame(gillnet_length = 100, gillnet_mesh = 50), # Data frame     list(data.frame(gillnet_length = 150, gillnet_mesh = 60)), # List containing a data frame     list() # Empty list   ),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )  # Apply the function to standardize the 'gillnets' column core_data <- standardize_list_column(core_data, "gillnets")  # Unnest the 'gillnets' column gillnets_data <- core_data %>%   select(submission_id, gillnets) %>%   unnest(gillnets, keep_empty = TRUE)  # View the result print(gillnets_data) } # }

title: Validate Catch Data — validate_catch
text: function validates catch data comparing calculated upper bounds get_catch_bounds function. catch value exceeds upper bound, alert triggered catch value set NA.

title: Validate Catch Data — validate_catch
text: data data frame containing catch data columns: survey_id, gear, catch_taxon, weight_type, catch_kg. k numeric value used get_catch_bounds function outlier detection.

title: Validate Catch Data — validate_catch
text: data frame columns: form_name: name form associated survey survey_id: unique identifier survey catch_kg: original catch weight valid, otherwise NA alert_catch: numeric value (4) indicating outlier, NA value valid

title: Validate Catch Data — validate_catch
text: function first calculates catch bounds using get_catch_bounds(). joins bounds input data compares catch_kg value corresponding upper bound. catch_kg value greater equal upper bound, alert set catch_kg value changed NA.

title: Validate Landing Dates — validate_dates
text: function checks validity landing_date provided dataset comparing submission_date. landing_date submission_date, alert triggered landing_date set NA records.

title: Validate Landing Dates — validate_dates
text: data data frame containing landing_date submission_date columns.

title: Validate Landing Dates — validate_dates
text: data frame three columns: survey_id: unique identifier survey landing_date: original date valid, otherwise NA alert_date: numeric value (1) indicating invalid date, NA date valid

title: Validate Fisheries Data — validate_landings
text: function imports validates preprocessed fisheries data MongoDB collection. performs series validation checks ensure data integrity, including checks dates, fisher counts, boat numbers, catch weights, IMEI numbers. function compiles validated data corresponding alert flags, subsequently uploaded back MongoDB.

title: Validate Fisheries Data — validate_landings
text: log_threshold Logging threshold level (default: logger::DEBUG)

title: Validate Fisheries Data — validate_landings
text: function return value. processes data uploads validated results MongoDB collection pipeline database.

title: Validate Fisheries Data — validate_landings
text: function performs following main operations: Pulls preprocessed landings data preprocessed MongoDB collection. Validates data consistency accuracy, focusing : Date validation Number fishers Number boats Catch weights prices IMEI numbers Generates validated dataset integrates results validation checks. Creates alert flags identify track data issues discovered validation. Merges validated data additional metadata, survey details landing site information. Uploads validated dataset validated MongoDB collection.

title: Validate Fisheries Data — validate_landings
text: function requires configuration file present readable 'read_config' function, provide MongoDB connection details parameters validation.

title: Validate Number of Boats — validate_nboats
text: function validates n_boats column provided dataset using alert_outlier function detect outliers. outlier detected, alert triggered n_boats value set NA.

text: data data frame containing n_boats column. k numeric value used LocScaleB function outlier detection.

title: Validate Number of Boats — validate_nboats
text: data frame three columns: survey_id: unique identifier survey n_boats: original number boats valid, otherwise NA alert_n_boats: numeric value (3) indicating outlier, NA value valid

title: Validate Number of Fishers — validate_nfishers
text: function validates n_fishers column provided dataset using alert_outlier function detect outliers. outlier detected, alert triggered n_fishers value set NA.

title: Validate Number of Fishers — validate_nfishers
text: data data frame containing n_fishers column. k numeric value used LocScaleB function outlier detection.

title: Validate Number of Fishers — validate_nfishers
text: data frame three columns: survey_id: unique identifier survey n_fishers: original number fishers valid, otherwise NA alert_n_fishers: numeric value (2) indicating outlier, NA value valid

what: Validate Catch Price per Kilogram — validate_pricekg
title: Validate Catch Price per Kilogram — validate_pricekg
text: function validates price per kilogram catch data comparing calculated upper lower bounds get_pricekg_bounds function. price value outside bounds, alert triggered price, catch weight, total catch price values set NA.

title: Validate Catch Price per Kilogram — validate_pricekg
Validate Catch Price per Kilogram — validate_pricekg
text: data data frame containing catch data columns: form_name, survey_id, catch_taxon, price_kg_USD, catch_price, catch_kg. k numeric value used get_pricekg_bounds function outlier detection.

title: Validate Catch Price per Kilogram — validate_pricekg
text: data frame columns: form_name: name form associated survey survey_id: unique identifier survey price_kg_USD: original price per kg valid, otherwise NA catch_kg: original catch weight price valid, otherwise NA catch_price: original total catch price price per kg valid, otherwise NA alert_price: numeric value (4) indicating outlier, NA value valid

title: Validate Catch Price per Kilogram — validate_pricekg
text: function first calculates price bounds using get_pricekg_bounds(). joins bounds input data compares price_kg_USD value corresponding upper lower bounds. price_kg_USD value outside bounds, alert set price_kg_USD, catch_kg, catch_price values changed NA.

title: Validate IMEI Number — validate_this_imei
text: function validates single IMEI number list valid IMEIs.

title: Validate IMEI Number — validate_this_imei
text: this_imei IMEI number validate. this_id survey ID associated IMEI (optional). valid_imeis vector valid IMEI numbers check .

title: Validate IMEI Number — validate_this_imei
text: list three elements: imei: validated IMEI found, otherwise NA alert_number: alert code (1, 2, 3) validation fails, otherwise NA survey_id: provided survey ID

title: Validate IMEI Number — validate_this_imei
text: Alert codes: 1: IMEI short (less 5 digits) 2: Multiple valid IMEIs match provided IMEI 3: valid IMEI matches provided IMEI
